titles.title: Providing for consideration of the Senate amendment to the bill (H.R. 2029) making appropriations for military construction, the Department of Veterans Affairs, and related agencies for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2016, and for other purposes; providing for proceedings during the period from December 19, 2015, through January 4, 2016; and for other purposes.

Providing for consideration of the Senate amendment to the bill (H.R. 2029) making appropriations for military construction, the Department of Veterans Affairs, and related agencies for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2016, and for other purposes; providing for proceedings during the period from December 19, 2015, through January 4, 2016; and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 114-382, by Mr. Cole.

Providing for consideration of the Senate amendment to H.R. 2029. Resolution makes in order a motion that the House concur in the Senate amendment with 2 House amendments. Each amendment is debatable for one hour. The resolution provides that the question shall be divided between the two House amendments. If only House amendment #2 is adopted, that amendment shall be engrossed as an amendment in the nature of a substitute to the Senate amendment to H.R. 2029.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 82.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 566.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 244 - 177 (Roll no. 701).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 240 - 185 (Roll no. 702).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the Senate amendment to the bill (H.R. 2029) making appropriations for military construction, the Department of Veterans Affairs, and related agencies for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2016, and for other purposes; providing for proceedings during the period from December 19, 2015, through January 4, 2016.
